description: A large green parrot with a distinct patch of yellow on the crown. They are often confused with the Yellow-naped and Double Yellow-headed Amazons.
temperament: Intelligent and playful. They are often considered to be a bit calmer and less prone to the intense aggression of the other two 'yellow head' types, but still require firm handling.
loudness: Loud. Can produce the classic loud Amazon screams.
vocalization: Very good talkers, though perhaps slightly less gifted on average than the Yellow-naped and Double Yellow-headed.
dietaryNeeds: A low-fat diet is crucial. Base the diet on pellets and a wide variety of vegetables.
healthPointers: Can live for 60+ years. Prone to obesity, fatty liver disease, and Vitamin A deficiency.
housing: Needs a large, strong cage. Minimum 36"W x 24"D x 48"H. Unsuitable for apartments.
